byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Havana and Vatican City, Azam Ahmed from Havana, and Victoria Burnett from Mexico City.
byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY, AZAM AHMED and VICTORIA BURNETT

abstract: Pope Francis visits Cuba in effort to revive Catholic Church cowed by decades of repression under Communist government; Francis is expected to press for more freedom for church while navigating Cuba's fraught relationship with its dissidents.
lead_paragraph: Francis arrived in Havana on Saturday for the first stop of a nine-day papal trip that includes the United States. The first Latin American pope must now try to open up Cuba to the Roman Catholic Church.

headline.main: Pope Francis, Arriving in Cuba, Seeks to Revive Church
headline.print_headline: Pope, Arriving in Cuba, Seeks to Revive Church

snippet: Francis arrived in Havana on Saturday for the first stop of a nine-day papal trip that includes the United States. The first Latin American pope must now try to open up Cuba to the Roman Catholic Church.
